humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, sentinel lymph nodes 1 and 2 were examined and no evidence of metastatic tumor was found on H&E, step sections, or cytokeratin stains. This indicates that there are no positive lymph nodes, which corresponds to N0 (no regional lymph node metastasis) as per the AJCC staging system. The new rules 10 and 11 also support this finding, as they specify that N0 can indicate no metastatic carcinoma in sentinel lymph nodes and regional lymph nodes or that all assessed lymph nodes are negative for metastatic carcinoma.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The pathology report indicates that two sentinel lymph nodes (specimens A and B) were removed and examined. No evidence of metastatic tumor was found in these nodes, as stated in the 'Linical Diagnoses' section: 'NO EVIDENCE OF METASTATIC TUMOR ON H&E. STEP SECTIONS OR CYTOKERATIN STAINS IN 4 LYMPH NODES EXAMINED.' Therefore, the patient's N stage is N0 (no regional lymph node metastasis).
